Texts.Chs: “我们从暮光之厅崛起，同样也会归于它们之中。”当我问维亚尼特家族的长者为什么他们的人民愿意生活在这样阴毒的地方时，他给我的谚语就是这句。他的意思，虽然没有马上理解，但几个星期之后我就全然了解了。
Texts.Eng: 'From the Twilight Halls we rose, and to them we shall all return.' ; Such was the wisdom the Elder of the Vyanit Clan imparted to me when I asked him why his people lived in such dark and poisonous places. His meaning, while not immediately understood, became so after several weeks among them.

Texts.Chs: 一份详细描述夜族人生活的文件。
Texts.Eng: A document that details Nightarian life.

Texts.Chs: 同样，夜族人相信蝴蝶是耀光的使者，与幽灵、恶魔和他们版本的死亡联系在一起。
Texts.Eng: Likewise, it is believed that butterflies are messengers of the Great Light, and are associated with spectres, demons and their version of Death.

Texts.Chs: 夜族脱离尘世。他们的整个文化根植于月相和黑暗，由于他们对所有形式的自然光的先天敏感。根据文献记载，类似于人类对阳光的异常过敏一样，夜族人在沐浴于阳光的自然光下无法正常工作。
Texts.Eng: The Nightar are a curious lot. Their entire culture is rooted around moon phases and darkness, due to their innate sensitivity to all forms of natural light. Texts.Chs: 这也导致了许多文化特性(特别是在宗教方面。 它们是唯一一种想消除太阳光而不是将其神化的种族)。以他们的结婚仪式为例。他们通常只在无月的夜晚进行“生命链接”，以免受到太阳的邪恶力量的影响而破坏这一过程。。
Texts.Eng: bathed in the natural light of the sun. This has led to many cultural peculiarities (especially in regards to religion. They are the only known race that villifies solar aspects, rather than deifying them). Take, for instance, their marriage ceremony. It is customary to engage in a 'life-bonding'

Texts.Chs: 人们相信，他们的后代将会受到诅咒，他们的肉将会“被晒黑，就像那些在地面上行走的皮兽一样”。请注意，请注意，这并不适用于他们中的每个人，但是大多数人在这方面都同意他们的文化历史。
Texts.Eng: made for any mooned night where the satellite is a half-moon or smaller. It is believed that their offspring will be cursed and that their flesh will be 'tanned and as of the leathered beasts that walk the surface'. Note that this does not apply to every single one of them, but most agree with their cultural history in

Texts.Chs: 如果有（即使是一点点）阳光照进地平线，则禁止新娘和新郎完成婚姻。卫星为半月或更短的满月之夜除外。
Texts.Eng: only during a moonless night, lest any influence of the suns vile power cause ruination of the union. A bride and groom are forbidden from consummating their union if any (even the slightest bit) of sunlight bathes a horizon. Exceptions are

Texts.Chs: 即使是那些在阳光下行走在行星表面的生物，也会遭到更狂热的同类的绝对鄙视和迷信的恐惧。那些不信奉宗教的人仍然不信任这种生物，尤其是那些特别毛茸茸的生物。
Texts.Eng: this regard. Even creatures that walk on the surface of a planet during the sunlight hours are viewed with absolute disdain and superstitious fear by the more zealous of their kind. Those who do not practice their religions are still distrustful of such creatures, especially those which are particularly fluffy.
